revised_title: Further Investigations on the Electrolysis of Secondary Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the electrolysis of various secondary compounds, including copper, silver, lead, palladium, and mercury, and demonstrates that the metal travels as a metal towards the platinode while the compound anion passes to the zincode. This study provides evidence for the general analogy in the constitution of all salts, whether derived from oxyacids or hydroacids.
